title: We are the Breath of Eternal God and the Stuff of Decaying Earth
description:
Bret Weinstein has been tweeting lately about God, Christianity and humanity's future. He offered his anthropology on an Unbelievable conversation with Alister McGrath saying that people are the products of Darwinian processes of genetic evolution and cultural evolution. I agree. He complains that Richard Dawkins didn't take his meme idea far enough. I don't think Bret takes his cultural evolutionary process far enough to fully appreciate the role of religion in bringing humanity where it is today. I don't think Bret's anthropology is far from the one laid out in Genesis 2 where God makes the man from the dust of the earth and with divine breath breathes life into us. We are a combination of culture/story verse and planet earth. 

Bret and Alister McGrath on Unbelievable https://youtu.be/kRx2uNMJFnU
Yuval Harari Sapiens https://amzn.to/37Jbj7Z
Jordan Peterson 12 Rules for Life https://amzn.to/2OOiHGf
Another Miss Oh https://amzn.to/2XRuBDq
Maps of Meaning https://amzn.to/34lxzCF
Black Earth by Timothy Snyder https://amzn.to/2DmK2dn
Jonathan Haidt Happiness Hypothesis https://amzn.to/2KVQCvt
Joe Rogan and Richard Dawkins https://youtu.be/_bN4spt3744
Jordan Peterson and Matt Dillahunty https://youtu.be/FmH7JUeVQb8
Jordan Peterson and Tim Lott https://youtu.be/RIB05YeMiW8
MIroslav Volf Exclusion and Embrace https://amzn.to/37JcSmn
The Ideas of Rene Girard https://amzn.to/33oKxhC
Dominion by Tom Holland https://amzn.to/2XQoJdE
John Vervaeke and JP Marceau Metaphysics https://youtu.be/DWg8-VxnOog
Daniel Bonevac Manifest Image Scientific Image Wilfred Sellars https://youtu.be/aVoWTnpF5ew
James KA Smith on Rebel Wisdom https://youtu.be/AoCJXjJQwVo
